description:
Located in the Seven Dials Conservation Area, David Kohn Architects' tiered rooftop extension creates a new family home that responds to the richness of its historic context, the surrounding rooflines, and the robustness of the existing brick warehouse building beneath.

Please note: No photography allowed.

factsheet.heading: About Smart's Place
paragraphs: The apartment is located on Smart's Place in Holborn, within a dense network of narrow streets and blind alleys lined with mainly Victorian buildings, and situated within the Seven Dials Conservation Area. David Kohn Architectsâ€™ tiered extension responds to the richness of the surrounding roof lines, and the robust of the existing commercial building beneath.

Each storey steps back to reflect changing scales from multi-storey offices to domestic almshouses, with bayed facades that further engage with the architectural language of their surroundings while breaking up the massing of the extension. This respectful design approach clearly distinguishes old from new, and allows the subsidiary relationship of the new apartment to its host to be understood. Inside, the series of step-backs and bays creates rooms with unique qualities, as well as various views, light and spaces.
The design features a series of outdoor private terraces on each tier of the apartment, that when planted, will create a luxuriant green foil for the development in a Babylonian-style hanging garden.
